nodes.bodyText: This is ok if we don't expect multi-threaded usage. Otherwise more synchronization is needed.
Not sure indeed, to be checked

The registration part seems safe as it's called by the startup thread. However other getContribution* calls are potentially done after startup.
So let's play it safe: make the initialized flag volatile and use double-checked locking to change it (and also setting it in setInitialized should also have a synchronization).
Also the datastructures in the registries (tags, registrations in the abstract class and other ones in the concrete classes) should all be thread-safe (—> new ConcurentHashMap, ConcurrentHashMap.newKeySet(), new CopyOnWriteArrayList, and read/write the enabled flag in a synchronized block too)
